name: Draven and Friends
whenToMake: Go for this comp if you have good items for Draven or are able to find a VIP Draven.
description: This comp revolves around Draven as the main attack damage carry and a flexible supporting cast of utility and frontline.
compTips: Draven already has a lot of built in Armor Piercing with his passive, so you won't need to build Last Whisper. A VIP Draven will also have infinite range, so focus on scaling his damage through things like Crit, Hurricane, and a strong third item like Bloodthirster or Quicksilver for some defense.

hextechAugments.name: Very VIP
hextechAugments.bonus: When an ally dies, they grant the Debonair VIP 30% of their maximum Health for the rest of combat. Gain a Syndra.

hextechAugments.name: Irresistible Charm
hextechAugments.bonus: Debonair champions take 15% less damage. Gain a Leona.

hextechAugments.name: Debonair Crown
hextechAugments.bonus: Gain 2 Debonair Emblems.

early.description: Challengers in the early make for an easy transition, and Bodyguards are also the preferred frontline.

mid.description: In the mid game, you can look to add in some Debonair units to prepare for Draven.

late.description: This comp revolves around Draven as the main attack damage carry and a flexible supporting cast of utility and frontline.

items.name: Bloodthirster
items.description: Physical damage heals the holder for @Lifesteal@% of the damage dealt. Upon falling below @HealthThreshold@% Health, the holder gains a @ShieldHealthPercent@% maximum Health shield that lasts up to @ShieldDuration@ seconds.

items.name: Guinsoo's Rageblade
items.description: Attacks grant +@AttackSpeedPerStack@% bonus Attack Speed for the rest of combat. This effect can stack any number of times.

name: Scrap Irelia
whenToMake: Go for this comp if you have good Irelia items. Having a good Socialite spot for Irelia is also ideal, but not a requirement.
description: This comp revolves around Irelia as the main carry and uses the Scrap trait to buff up the team. Instead of going too deep into traits like Striker or Scrap, this comp goes into 3 Socialite instead to further buff up Irelia.
compTips: Irelia can use a variety of Socialite spots. Having it in the back row is not ideal as Irelia will need to walk up, but it's still usable. Even if the Hex is in the front row, you can still surround Irelia with other frontline units, so no need to worry there.

hextechAugments.name: Junkyard
hextechAugments.bonus: Every 4 combat rounds with the Scrap Trait active, gain a random component.

hextechAugments.name: Socialite Soul
hextechAugments.bonus: Your team counts as having 2 additional Socialites.

hextechAugments.name: Knife's Edge III
hextechAugments.bonus: Your units that start combat in the first 2 rows gain 50 Attack Damage.

early.description: Build around Scrap units and Attack Damage units to hold items for Irelia.

mid.description: By this point, you can start adding in stronger 3-cost units like Ekko, Senna, and Gnar.

late.description: This comp revolves around Irelia as the main carry and uses the Scrap trait to buff up the team. Instead of going too deep into traits like Striker or Scrap, this comp goes into 3 Socialite instead to further buff up Irelia.

name: Strikers
whenToMake: Go for this comp if you have a lot of good Attack Damage items.
description: This comp looks to use Sivir and Irelia as the main DPS carries. Irelia and Sivir are both Attack Damage carries, making this comp great if you have lots of Swords, Bows, and Gloves.
compTips: If you're able to get an Augment like Verdant Veil, you can opt not to build Quicksilver on your carries. This gives you an extra item slot for more damage like Giant Slayer or something else.

hextechAugments.name: Verdant Veil
hextechAugments.bonus: Your units are immune to crowd control effects for the first 15 seconds of combat.

hextechAugments.name: Knife's Edge III
hextechAugments.bonus: Your units that start combat in the first 2 rows gain 50 Attack Damage.

hextechAugments.name: Concussive Blows
hextechAugments.bonus: Striker's critical strikes stun their target for 1.5 second(s). Each target can only be stunned once every 6 seconds. Gain a Rek'sai.

early.description: Simply look for frontline units along with Strikers or any Attack Damage unit to hold your items. Units with Hextech are also nice to use early on as well.

mid.description: Hopefully you can get lucky and find Irelia or Sivir at level 6 as this will let you put in 4 Strikers. If not, you can simply put in any unit like Senna instead.

late.description: This comp looks to use Sivir and Irelia as the main DPS carries. Irelia and Sivir are both Attack Damage carries, making this comp great if you have lots of Swords, Bows, and Gloves.

name: 6 Yordles
whenToMake: Go for this comp if you have a good start with Yordle units and good items for Corki.
description: This comp looks to use the Yordle trait to build up a team of 3-star units. Corki is the main damage carry of the team, while Poppy is the main tank of the team.
compTips: At level 7, before you find Veigar, you can use Blitzcrank as your 7th unit. Depending on how early you find Veigar, you can potentially put in Veigar 3 at level 8. This requires you to complete all of the other 3-star Yordles very quickly.

hextechAugments.name: Thieving Rascals
hextechAugments.bonus: Free Yordles from the portal have 33% chance to arrive holding an item component. Gain a Lulu.

hextechAugments.name: So Small
hextechAugments.bonus: Yordles gain 35% Dodge Chance.

hextechAugments.name: Trade Sector
hextechAugments.bonus: Gain a free Shop refresh each round.

early.description: Simple enough, use Yorldes early game and other units for supporting traits.

mid.description: Level 6 is also just as easy to build around. Just put in all 6 of the Yordle units.

late.description: This comp looks to use the Yordle trait to build up a team of 3-star units. Corki is the main damage carry of the team, while Poppy is the main tank of the team.

name: Tesla in Orbit
whenToMake: Go for this comp if you have a really strong win streak and can comfortably go Fast 8. You can also lose streak for economy, or have a strong Augment for economy like Rich get Richer, etc.
description: This comp is our take on a Fast 8 comp that uses lots of 5-cost units. Zeri is the main late game carry of the team comp, and this comp caps out at level 9.
compTips: Jayce, Silco, and Tahm Kench are all strong 5-cost units for the late game, but only Silco provides a trait for the team (Scholar). If you are trying to find what units to use at level 8, Syndra can be a replacement for either Jayce or Tahm Kench, but the frontline will be a bit weaker. At level 9, this comp can really shine with all of the units in.

hextechAugments.name: Cybernetic Implants III
hextechAugments.bonus: Your units equipped with an item gain 350 Health and 30 Attack Damage

hextechAugments.name: Backfoot II
hextechAugments.bonus: Your units that start combat in the back 2 rows gain 30% Attack Speed.

hextechAugments.name: Mercenary Heart
hextechAugments.bonus: Your team counts as having 1 additional Mercenary.

early.description: Debonairs like Syndra and Brand can be used for the early game, or you can run just about any units you find to try and win streak. You can also look to use Yordles to try and build up economy early game as well.

mid.description: You can keep using Yordles to gain economy, or you can look to win streak by putting in stronger units. Ideally, you can do both.

late.description: This comp is our take on a Fast 8 comp that uses lots of 5-cost units. Zeri is the main late game carry of the team comp, and this comp caps out at level 9.

name: Brand Reroll
whenToMake: Go for this comp if you find VIP Brand and have good items for him.
description: This comp focuses on Brand as the main carry and builds around the Debonair and Syndicate trait. There are a lot of options that you can add in at level 8 like two more Debonair units or strong late game units like Enchanters or Socialite, etc.
compTips: If you have things like Debonair Heart or Debonair Emblem, you may be able to reach 5 Debonair easily. You can itemize Brand with Jeweled Gauntlet and Infinity Edge over Rabadon's and Hextech Gunblade if you have a lot of extra ability power through things like Chalice of Power, Battlemage, Debonair, etc.

mid.description: By this point, you should have most of your team together already. If you don't have Ahri and Braum yet, simply use lower cost units that fulfill a similar role.

late.description: This comp focuses on Brand as the main carry and builds around the Debonair and Syndicate trait. There are a lot of options that you can add in at level 8 like two more Debonair units or strong late game units like Enchanters or Socialite, etc.

name: Dr. Doom
whenToMake: Go for this comp if you have enough gold to Fast 8 and have good Viktor items. Finding Silco and Viktor at level 8 is also important.
description: This comp revolves around Viktor as the main damage carry and uses Silco to allow Viktor to cast his ability quickly. The comp uses a lot of late game units, so going Fast 8 is recommended for this comp.
compTips: When you're at level 8, you likely will want to drop Ziggs and save him for level 9. Ziggs will provide Arcanist and Scrap, but is the weakest member on the team.

hextechAugments.bonus: Your units gain 5 Attack Damage and Ability Power per Trait active across your team.

name: Synaptic Mutants
whenToMake: Go for this comp if you find an early Cho'Gath. This will let you build up feast stacks. Synaptic Web is also ideal for lowered mana cost.
description: This comp is very similar to what we've seen in Set 6 with Mutants. Cho'Gath and Malzahar are still the two main carries of the comp, and are the units you also want to 3 star. You can choose to slow roll at 7 for these units, but you can simply level normally and look for 3 star units at level 8.
compTips: Finding an early Cho'Gath is definitely a huge prerequisite for this comp. The feast stacks are what make Cho'Gath tanky enough to scale into the mid game and eventually the late game. If you don't have a two star Cho'Gath at level 6, you can even roll down to find him as this is a huge power spike for the comp.

hextechAugments.name: Mutant Crown
hextechAugments.bonus: Gain 2 Mutant Emblems.

hextechAugments.name: Unstable Evolution
hextechAugments.bonus: Mutants randomly gain one of the following when they reach 2 star: 500 Health, 30% Attack Speed, 30 Attack Damage, or 30 Ability Power. These bonuses stack.

hextechAugments.name: Armor Plating
hextechAugments.bonus: Colossus become invulnerable for 2 seconds the first time their Health drops to 60% and 30%.

early.description: Ideally you have an early Cho'Gath to throw in.

mid.description: You likely won't hit 5 Mutant until level 7, so simply add in things like Bruisers or Arcanists for Cho'Gath and Malzahar.

late.description: This comp is very similar to what we've seen in Set 6 with Mutants. Cho'Gath and Malzahar are still the two main carries of the comp, and are the units you also want to 3 star. name: Talon Reroll
whenToMake: Go for this comp if you have find Talon early or have good items for Talon.
description: As the name suggests, this comp centers around Talon as the main carry. Assassins and Debonairs are the main trait for this comp, and getting a VIP Talon shouldn't be too hard since you are slow rolling at level 6.
compTips: Since this comp is slow rolling at level 6, you don't have to always lose streak in the early game. You can level up early to win streak instead, but lose streaking is more consistent for building up gold as you can somewhat control losing compared to winning. Only go for win streaks if you are confident in your team.

hextechAugments.name: Very VIP
hextechAugments.bonus: When an ally dies, they grant the Debonair VIP 30% of their maximum Health for the rest of combat. Gain a Syndra.

hextechAugments.name: Smoke Bomb
hextechAugments.bonus: The first time Assassins drop below 70% Health, they briefly enter stealth, becoming untargetable and shedding all negative effects. Any excess damage is reduced by 60%. Gain a Talon.

hextechAugments.name: Phalanx III
hextechAugments.bonus: Your units that start combat in the back 2 rows gain 50 Armor and Magic Resist.

early.description: You don't have to build into Debonair right away as the units you will be using don't synergize too well. You can either build around Talon, or build around something like Yordles to gain gold instead.

mid.description: At level 6, you definitely will want to have 3 Debonair in to get good chances of finding VIP Talon. Fill in the other units with things like Assassins or frontline.

late.description: As the name suggests, this comp centers around Talon as the main carry. Assassins and Debonairs are the main trait for this comp, and getting a VIP Talon shouldn't be too hard since you are slow rolling at level 6.

name: Twitch Reroll
whenToMake: Go for this comp if you find a lot of Twitchs early.
description: This comp revolves around Twitch as the main carry and builds into Innovator 5 for utility and frontline. Many of the units on the team are low cost, giving you multiple targets to 3 star.
compTips: Even though Twitch is strong, it's also important that your frontline buys enough time for Twitch. If the frontline dies too quickly, the enemy will retarget onto Twitch and Ekko, which is not ideal.

name: 6 Scrap
whenToMake: Go for this comp if you have a Scrap Emblem.
description: This is a comp you should go for if you are able to get a Scrap Emblem either from an Augment or something like Tome of Traits. The comp plays very similarly to Scrap Irelia, except with 6 Scrap, there are a few adjustments and it also allows you to build into Jinx very easily.
compTips: Even though Jinx can be the main carry of this team comp, you may not always be able to find Jinx 2 easily. As such, you can simply build items for Irelia as your more consistent carry. Extra late game items can go on Jinx as she can use a variety of different items.

name: Warwick Reroll
whenToMake: Go for this comp if you have good items, augments, or find copies of Quinn/Warwick early.
description: This comp revolves around Warwick and Quinn as the dual carries of this comp. Warwick is a great frontline damage dealer, while Quinn is great for CC and backline damage. If you can't find Quinn 3, you can prioritize Warwick and itemize Renata also.
compTips: Zac and Tryndamere are also 3 star candidates, but they are quite expensive. Going for these may result in a lot of lost tempo. As such, the safer play is to prioritize Warwick and Quinn rather than the others.

hextechAugments.name: Knife's Edge III
hextechAugments.bonus: Your units that start combat in the first 2 rows gain 50 Attack Damage.

hextechAugments.name: Trade Sector
hextechAugments.bonus: Gain a free Shop refresh each round.

hextechAugments.name: En Garde
hextechAugments.bonus: The first time an enemy is attacked by a Challenger, they are Disarmed for 3 seconds.

early.description: Either build around Chemtech or Challengers depending on what you find.

mid.description: Continue adding in more Challengers or Chemtech units. You can even branch into Innovator with Singed and Zilean if you want.

late.description: This comp revolves around Warwick and Quinn as the dual carries of this comp. Warwick is a great frontline damage dealer, while Quinn is great for CC and backline damage. If you can't find Quinn 3, you can prioritize Warwick and itemize Renata also.

items.description:

items.description: Attacks grant +@AttackSpeedPerStack@% bonus Attack Speed for the rest of combat. This effect can stack any number of times.

items.description:
When the holder attacks or takes damage, they gain @StackingAD@ Attack Damage and Ability Power.

This stacks up to @StackCap@ times, at which point the holder gains @BonusResistsAtStackCap@ Armor and Magic Resist.

name: Hextech Sivir
whenToMake: Go for this comp if you have good Sivir items and have a good start with Hextech units.
description: This comp uses Sivir as the main carry and simply goes deep into the Hextech trait. The only unit that isn't a Hextech unit is Jinx.
compTips: Statikk Shiv is great for this comp as the Hextech trait provides magic damage on hit. Shiv will reduce the magic resistance of enemies, allowing the damage to scale for the entire team.

hextechAugments.name: Hexnova
hextechAugments.bonus: The first time a Hextech champion drops below 60% Health, they increase nearby enemies' maximum Mana by 50% until they cast. Gain a Nocturne.

hextechAugments.name: Stored Power
hextechAugments.bonus: Your Hextech champions permanently gain 1 Ability Power each time they are hit by your Hexcore's pulses. Gain a Swain.

hextechAugments.name: Hextech Crown
hextechAugments.bonus: Gain 2 Hextech Emblems.

early.description: Simply use as many Hextech units as you can.

mid.description: Continue throwing in more Hextech units. You can also use other units to provide other traits while you are transitioning.

late.description: This comp uses Sivir as the main carry and simply goes deep into the Hextech trait. The only unit that isn't a Hextech unit is Jinx.

items.name: Redemption
items.description: Every @HealTickRate@ seconds, the holder radiates an aura to allies within @HexRadius@ hex, healing them for @MissingHealthHeal@% of their missing Health. Affected allies take @AoEDamageReduction@% reduced damage from multi-target abilities and attacks for @HealTickRate@ seconds.

items.description: The holder gains %i:scaleArmor% @ArmorPerEnemy@ Armor and %i:scaleMR% @MRPerEnemy@ Magic Resist for each enemy targeting them.

items.description: The holder gains %i:scaleAS% @BonusAS@% bonus Attack Speed. Every 3rd attack from the holder unleashes a chain lightning that bounces to @1StarBounces@ enemies, dealing @Damage@ magic damage and reducing their Magic Resist by @MRShred@% for @MRShredDuration@ seconds.

items.name: Guinsoo's Rageblade
items.description: Attacks grant +@AttackSpeedPerStack@% bonus Attack Speed for the rest of combat. This effect can stack any number of times.

name: Jhin and Friends
whenToMake: Go for this comp if you find Jhin easily and have good items for him.
description: As the name suggests, this is simply a Jhin focused comp with the rest of the units providing utility and traits. This comp lives or dies based on how good Jhin is in the meta.
compTips: Before you find Silco, you will want to put Jhin in the backline. This is to increase the damage he does with Sniper. With Silco, however, the bonus mana is more important as it will get Jhin to activate his ability faster.

hextechAugments.name: Sniper's Nest
hextechAugments.bonus: Snipers gain +8% damage per round they’ve started combat in the same hex. (Maximum +32%)

hextechAugments.name: Sniper Crown
hextechAugments.bonus: Gain 2 Sniper Emblems.

hextechAugments.name: Stand United III
hextechAugments.bonus: Your units gain 5 Attack Damage and Ability Power per Trait active across your team.

early.description: The early game is a balance between frontline units and an attack damage backline.

mid.description: As usual, start adding in stronger 3-cost units to empower your early game.

late.description: As the name suggests, this is simply a Jhin focused comp with the rest of the units providing utility and traits. This comp lives or dies based on how good Jhin is in the meta.

name: Ashe Reroll
whenToMake: Go for this comp if you have good Ashe items and have a good start with Syndicates or have a lot of Ashes.
description: This comp revolves around Ashe as the main carry of a Syndicate comp. You have 3 good targets to slow roll for with Ashe, Zyra, and Morgana.
compTips: You can choose to slow roll this comp at level 6 or level 7. Level 6 is ideal for hitting Ashe and Zyra 3, but if you are strong or have a good amount of copies already, you can go for level 7. This way, you can add in Braum for Syndicate 5 and won't take bad losses while slow rolling.

hextechAugments.name: Syndicate Crown
hextechAugments.bonus: Gain 2 Syndicate Emblems.

hextechAugments.name: Payday
hextechAugments.bonus: After winning your combat, gain 1 bonus gold for each surviving Syndicate.

hextechAugments.name: Sniper's Nest
hextechAugments.bonus: Snipers gain +8% damage per round they’ve started combat in the same hex. (Maximum +40%)

early.description: Considering three of these units make the final team comp, this is what you should aim for early game.

mid.description: Add in more utility or frontline units to balance your team as you slow roll. Hopefully while you slow roll you are able to find Braum for the Syndicate 5 power spike.

late.description: This comp revolves around Ashe as the main carry of a Syndicate comp. You have 3 good targets to slow roll for with Ashe, Zyra, and Morgana.

name: Kha and Friends
whenToMake: Go for this comp if you have strong AD items and find Kha'Zix on your rolldown.
description: This comp revolves around Kha'Zix as the main carry and simply uses strong units to surround him. No large traits in Mutants or Assassins, just a strong overall comp. This makes flexing into Kha'Zix very easy as you can stay open with generally strong units.
compTips: This comp uses both Kha'Zix and Jhin, but you can also focus on putting items on Jhin if you find him first. As such, you can transition to a more centric comp, or if you have enough items for both carries, you can stick with this comp.

hextechAugments.name: Smoke Bomb
hextechAugments.bonus: The first time Assassins drop below 70% Health, they briefly enter stealth, becoming untargetable and shedding all negative effects. Any excess damage is reduced by 60%. Gain a Talon.

hextechAugments.name: Stand United III
hextechAugments.bonus: Your units gain 5 Attack Damage and Ability Power per Trait active across your team.

hextechAugments.name: Duet
hextechAugments.bonus: Summon 1 additional Socialite Spotlight. The Spotlight now grants 400 bonus Health.

early.description: Just about anything will do early game, just have an item holder for AD items.

mid.description: Keep adding in stronger units that compliment your early game.

late.description: This comp revolves around Kha'Zix as the main carry and simply uses strong units to surround him. No large traits in Mutants or Assassins, just a strong overall comp. This makes flexing into Kha'Zix very easy as you can stay open with generally strong units.

name: Sivir Strikers
whenToMake: Go for this comp if you have good items for Sivir and a good start with Striker / Scrap units.
description: This is yet another version of Strikers that focuses on Sivir as the main carry over Irelia. You can play very flexibly with all of the different Striker variations depending on your items and what units you find.
compTips: As mentioned in the description, this comp can easily be used to flex between other Striker comps. If you find Irelia first, you can always build more around Irelia and Socialite. If you find more Sivirs, you can even flex with Hextech Sivir comps. Stay open to units you find in your games.

hextechAugments.name: Concussive Blows
hextechAugments.bonus: Striker's critical strikes stun their target for 1.5 second(s). Each target can only be stunned once every 6 seconds. Gain a Rek'sai.

hextechAugments.name: Junkyard
hextechAugments.bonus: Every 4 combat rounds with the Scrap Trait active, gain a random component.

hextechAugments.name: Striker Crown
hextechAugments.bonus: Gain 2 Striker Emblems.

early.description: There are many good early game units to pick up. Look for things like Striker, Hextech, Bodyguard, Scrap, etc.

mid.description: In the mid game, you can start building into your 2 and 3-cost units that make the main team comp.

late.description: This is yet another version of Strikers that focuses on Sivir as the main carry over Irelia. You can play very flexibly with all of the different Striker variations depending on your items and what units you find.

name: Omnivamp Mutants
whenToMake: Go for this comp when the Mutant trait is Omnivamp.
description: This comp looks to run the Mutant trait with the Omnivamp bonus. This will provide the team with healing on all damage dealt. You will definitely want a 3 star Cho'Gath with this comp, but you will also need to hit level 8.
compTips: Building damage on Cho'Gath is our recommendation with this Omnivamp bonus, but other items can still work well. The usual tank items aren't too bad like Titan's Resolve.

hextechAugments.name: Armor Plating
hextechAugments.bonus: Colossus become invulnerable for 2 seconds the first time their Health drops to 60% and 30%.

hextechAugments.name: Shrug It Off
hextechAugments.bonus: Bruisers regenerate 2.5% of their maximum Health each second.

hextechAugments.name: Jeweled Lotus

early.description: Pick up the two early Mutant units and use whatever other units to synergize.

mid.description: At this point, you should definitely have Cho'Gath to fit in. Cho will take up 2 unit slots, so your level 6 may look something like this.

name: Syndra Scholars
whenToMake: Go for this comp if you find a VIP Syndra and/or the Lifelong Learning augment.
description: This comp revolves around a VIP Syndra and the 4 Scholar trait. Syndra and Renata are the main damage dealers, and the mana gain from Scholars empowers this comp. Having the Lifelong Learning Augment is also a huge bonus for this comp.
compTips: Syndra 3 is definitely ideal for this comp, but you can also try to simply go for level 8 to find high cost units like Renata and Silco. Try to decide which is better for the game you're playing.

name: Jhinnovator
whenToMake: Go for this comp if you have a good start with Innovators, or find something like an Innovator Heart or Emblem.
description: This comp is another take on the Innovator team comp except with Jhin as the main carry. This is a strong option if you have a lot of attack damage items rather than magic damage items for Seraphine.
compTips: As with any Innovator comp, having an Augment or Emblem will allow you to reach Innovator 7. Look to fit Singed back into the comp if this is the case.

hextechAugments.name: Self-Repair
hextechAugments.bonus: When the Innovation dies, it will become untargetable and repair itself if an Innovator is still alive.

hextechAugments.name: Ancient Archives
hextechAugments.bonus: Gain 1 Tome of Traits.

early.description: The 3 Innovators make for a very easy early game. Add in another unit like a Blitzcrank for more frontline and synergy.

mid.description: If you find Seraphine, you can rush to fit in Innovator 5. If not, simply add in strong mid game units like Ekko or more backline damage like Caitlyn.

late.description: This comp is another take on the Innovator team comp except with Jhin as the main carry. This is a strong option if you have a lot of attack damage items rather than magic damage items for Seraphine.

name: Dark Star Mutants
whenToMake: When the Mutant variant is Dark Star.
description: This comp looks to use the Voracious Appetite variant of Mutants in order to buff up powerful carries like Kha'Zix and Kai'Sa. Zz'Rots are important for this comp for the Mutant Buff, and a 1 star Kai'Sa with perfect items will carry hard.
compTips: This comp is very item hungry, so things like Pandora's or Component Grab Bag are great for hitting your item requirements.

hextechAugments.name: Phony Frontline
hextechAugments.bonus: Gain 2 Target Dummies.

hextechAugments.name: Pandora's Items
hextechAugments.bonus: Gain a random component. At the start of each turn, items on your bench are randomized (excluding Force of Nature, Spatula, and consumables).

hextechAugments.name: Component Grab Bag
hextechAugments.bonus: Gain 3 random item components.

early.description: Look for the early game Mutant units and other units that synergize with them.

mid.description: Swain is a great pair for Sejuani and Malzahar. Kha'Zix is a great addition whenever you find him. Lastly, make sure to pick up Camille and leave her on the bench for when you find Kai'Sa. Any Challenger works, but Camille is cheap.

late.description: This comp looks to use the Voracious Appetite variant of Mutants in order to buff up powerful carries like Kha'Zix and Kai'Sa. Zz'Rots are important for this comp for the Mutant Buff, and a 1 star Kai'Sa with perfect items will carry hard.

name: Reroll Senna
whenToMake: Go for this comp if you have good AD carry items and find lots of Sennas. Having Tri Force is also nice.
description: This comp centers around Senna as a reroll carry and Morgana as a frontline tank. The comp runs 4 Enchanters, meaning there is a lot of healing and shielding on this team.
compTips: You can still play this comp without Trinity Force, but it won't be as good. Other Augments that are good for this comp are things like Ardent Censer and even First Aid Kit.

hextechAugments.name: First Aid Kit
hextechAugments.bonus: All healing and shielding received by your units is increased by 35%.

hextechAugments.name: Ardent Censer
hextechAugments.bonus: Allies healed or shielded by Enchanters gain 50% stacking Attack Speed for the rest of combat (maximum once every 2 seconds). Gain a Lulu.

hextechAugments.name: Tri Force III
hextechAugments.bonus: Your 3-cost champions gain 333 Health, 33 Mana, and 33% Attack Speed.

early.description: This comp doesn't require any particular early game, but Innovators or Yordles make for a solid transition.

mid.description: Senna, Morgana, and Ekko will be your main upgrades in the mid game.

late.description: This comp centers around Senna as a reroll carry and Morgana as a frontline tank. The comp runs 4 Enchanters, meaning there is a lot of healing and shielding on this team.

On being hit by an attack, deal @1StarAoEDamage@/@2StarAoEDamage@/@3StarAoEDamage@ %i:star% magic damage to all nearby enemies (once every @ICD@ seconds).

items.name: Redemption
items.description: Every @HealTickRate@ seconds, the holder radiates an aura to allies within @HexRadius@ hex, healing them for @MissingHealthHeal@% of their missing Health. Affected allies take @AoEDamageReduction@% reduced damage from multi-target abilities and attacks for @HealTickRate@ seconds.

items.name: Warmog's Armor
items.description: Grants %i:scaleHealth% @Health@ bonus Health (including components).

items.name: Last Whisper
items.description:
When the holder inflicts a critical hit, the target's Armor is reduced by @ArmorReductionPercent@% for @ArmorBreakDuration@ seconds. This effect does not stack.

[Unique - only one per champion]

items.name: Infinity Edge
items.description:
Grants @CritChance@% Critical Strike Chance (including components) and @BonusCritDamage@% Critical Strike Damage. Each point of Critical Strike Chance above 100% becomes +@BonusCritDmgPerCritAbove100@% Critical Strike Damage.

[Unique - only 1 per champion]

items.name: Guinsoo's Rageblade
items.description: Attacks grant +@AttackSpeedPerStack@% bonus Attack Speed for the rest of combat. This effect can stack any number of times.

name: Reroll Trynd
whenToMake: Go for this comp if you find a good amount of Tryndameres early, and/or if you have good Tryndamere items.
description: This comp revolves around Tryndamere as the main slow roll carry of the team. Since he is a 3-cost unit, you will be slow rolling at level 7 for Tryndamere. Zac is the slow roll tank target, and Quinn is the backline slow roll target.
compTips: When building items for Tryndamere, you want to build things that scale multiplicatively with Attack Speed. Since Tryndamere already has Challenger and Chemtech, you want to build items that scale his damage through ways other than Attack Speed. Infinity Edge and Last Whisper are some examples. Even still, items like Quicksilver and Bloodthirster are necessary for him as a melee carry, so don't just build all damage.

hextechAugments.name: En Garde
hextechAugments.bonus: The first time an enemy is attacked by a Challenger, they are Disarmed for 3 seconds.

hextechAugments.name: Instant Injection
hextechAugments.bonus: Chemtechs now additionally trigger their bonuses at the start of combat.

hextechAugments.name: Knife's Edge III
hextechAugments.bonus: Your units that start combat in the first 2 rows gain 50 Attack Damage.

early.description: Simple enough, build around Challengers and Chemtech units early on.

mid.description: You should be able to find Tryndamere at level 6, so your comp should be almost complete at level 6, minus the 4-cost units that might take longer to find.

late.description: This comp revolves around Tryndamere as the main slow roll carry of the team. Since he is a 3-cost unit, you will be slow rolling at level 7 for Tryndamere. Zac is the slow roll tank target, and Quinn is the backline slow roll target.

items.description:
Every @ICD@ seconds, a random enemy within @HexRange@ hexes is burned for @BurnPercent@% of their maximum Health as true damage over @BurnDuration@ seconds. Any healing they receive is reduced by @GrievousWoundsPercent@%.

items.name: Bloodthirster
items.description: Physical damage heals the holder for @Lifesteal@% of the damage dealt. Upon falling below @HealthThreshold@% Health, the holder gains a @ShieldHealthPercent@% maximum Health shield that lasts up to @ShieldDuration@ seconds.

items.name: Spear of Shojin
items.description: The holder's attacks restore %i:scaleMana% @FlatManaRestore@ additional Mana.

items.description: The holder's magic and true damage from their Ability can critically strike. The holder gains @CritDamageAmp@% bonus Critical Strike Damage and %i:scaleAP% @TooltipBonusAP@ bonus Ability Power.

name: Syndicate Ahri
whenToMake: Go for this comp if you have a good start with Syndicate units and good items for Ahri.
description: This comp is a very basic comp that revolves around Ahri as the main carry and Syndicate as the main trait to build around.
compTips: Ahri positioning can be tough as you want her to hit as many enemies as possible. Placing her near the edge but not in the corner is a good way to maximize your damage, while also keeping her safe.

hextechAugments.name: Payday
hextechAugments.bonus: After winning your combat, gain 1 bonus gold for each surviving Syndicate.

hextechAugments.name: Syndicate Crown
hextechAugments.bonus: Gain 2 Syndicate Emblems.

hextechAugments.name: Battlemage III
hextechAugments.bonus: Your units that start combat in the front 2 rows gain 50 Ability Power.

early.description: Syndicates can be used early on, and units like Ashe can be used to hold items for Ahri very easily. Since Ashe is a Sniper, you can look to use a unit like Caitlyn in the early game instead of Arcanists.

mid.description: In the Mid Game, look to add in more Syndicate units and other mid game units to add in more traits like Bodyguard.

late.description: This comp is a very basic comp that revolves around Ahri as the main carry and Syndicate as the main trait to build around.

items.name: Rabadon's Deathcap
items.description: Grants %i:scaleAP% @AP@ bonus Ability Power (including components).

items.name: Blue Buff
items.description:
The holder gains %i:scaleMana% @Mana@ Starting Mana (including components). After casting their Ability, the holder gains %i:scaleMana% @ManaRestore@ mana.

[Unique - only 1 per champion]

items.name: Hextech Gunblade
items.description: The holder's magic and true damage from Abilities heal them for @OmniVamp@% of the damage dealt. The holder also heals their lowest Health ally for the same amount.

name: Renata Bruisers
whenToMake: Go for this comp if you have good items for Renata and have a good start with Bruiser units.
description: This comp focuses on Renata who deals a lot of damage over time. Bruisers are there to soak up damage and stall for Renata to whittle away at enemy units.
compTips: Before transitioning into Renata, you will want to use units that utilize Ability Power items well. A unit like Miss Fortune is a great example of this. Pair her along with Caitlyn for the early game and use her as a transition unit for Renata.

hextechAugments.name: Shrug It Off
hextechAugments.bonus: Bruisers regenerate 2.5% of their maximum Health each second.

hextechAugments.name: Bruiser Crown
hextechAugments.bonus: Gain 2 Bruiser Emblems.

hextechAugments.name: Battlemage III
hextechAugments.bonus: Your units that start combat in the front 2 rows gain 50 Ability Power.

early.description: Bruisers are an obvious choice for the mid game, and a unit like Caitlyn will also help transition into the mid game.

mid.description: By the mid game, you can add in more Brawlers, and a unit like Miss Fortune to hold items for Renata.

late.description: This comp focuses on Renata who deals a lot of damage over time. Bruisers are there to soak up damage and stall for Renata to whittle away at enemy units.

items.description: Enemies within @HexRange@ hexes have their Magic Resist reduced by @MRShred@%. When they cast an Ability, they are zapped taking magic damage equal to @ManaRatio@% of their maximum Mana.

items.name: Titan's Resolve
items.description:
When the holder attacks or takes damage, they gain @StackingAD@ Attack Damage and Ability Power.

This stacks up to @StackCap@ times, at which point the holder gains @BonusResistsAtStackCap@ Armor and Magic Resist.

[Unique - only 1 per champion]

items.name: Blue Buff
items.description:

items.description: The holder's magic and true damage from Abilities heal them for @OmniVamp@% of the damage dealt. The holder also heals their lowest Health ally for the same amount.

name: Innovators
whenToMake: Go for this comp if you have an Innovator Heart/Soul or an Innovator Emblem.
description: This comp looks to get 7 Innovator by either having a Hextech Augment that provides Innovator, or by getting a Tome of Traits to get an Innovator Emblem. This allows you to have a very high health Dragon that provides insane amounts of utility and frontline. Jayce is one carry that does amazing with tanky items, while Seraphine is the backline carry with magic damage items.
compTips: For this comp, we are showing you the best comp if you only are able to have 5 Innovators. If you have an Emblem or Augment that gives you another Innovator, you can look to add in one more Innovator at level 9, or you can replace a unit to hit Innovator 7 at level 8. For example, you can replace Vi with Singed in this scenario.

hextechAugments.name: Innovator Soul
hextechAugments.bonus: Your team counts as having 2 additional Innovators.

hextechAugments.name: Self-Repair
hextechAugments.bonus: When the Innovation dies, it will become untargetable and repair itself if an Innovator is still alive.

hextechAugments.name: Innovator Heart
hextechAugments.bonus: Your team counts as having 1 additional Innovator.

early.description: Innovators make for a great early comp core for this comp. As usual, pair these units with supporting trait units.

mid.description: If you find Seraphine, you can go for 5 Innovator, or you can add in more 3-cost units like Morgana and Ekko to the team comp.

late.description: This comp looks to get 7 Innovator by either having a Hextech Augment that provides Innovator, or by getting a Tome of Traits to get an Innovator Emblem. This allows you to have a very high health Dragon that provides insane amounts of utility and frontline. Jayce is one carry that does amazing with tanky items, while Seraphine is the backline carry with magic damage items.

name: 6 Arcanist
whenToMake: Go for this comp if you have good AP items and a start with Yordles.
description: This comp is a simple 6 Arcanist comps that revolves around Ahri as the main carry and Vex as the main tank. Silco, Jinx, and Viktor are simply strong 5-cost units that go in for the endgame.
compTips: Before using units like Jinx and Silco, you can look for strong Enchanter units like Morgana or Lulu in the meantime.

hextechAugments.name: Spell Blade
hextechAugments.bonus: After casting their Ability, Arcanists’ next attack deals bonus magic damage equal to 180% of their Ability Power.

hextechAugments.name: Runic Shield III
hextechAugments.bonus: Arcanists start combat with a shield equal to 600% Ability Power for 8 seconds.

hextechAugments.name: Arcanist Heart
hextechAugments.bonus: Your team counts as having 1 additional Arcanist. Gain a Swain.

early.description: Simple enough, use Yordles and a unit like Blitzcrank to pair with Ziggs for Scrap and Poppy for Bodyguard.

mid.description: Start looking to add in more Arcanists, and move your tank and carry items to Poppy and Malzahar respectively.

late.description: This comp is a simple 6 Arcanist comps that revolves around Ahri as the main carry and Vex as the main tank. Silco, Jinx, and Viktor are simply strong 5-cost units that go in for the endgame.
